title: Hands-On Geospatial AI for Environmental Applications
text:
Preface
I have been thinking of writing a live document for a long time now. The main idea for this book is not just to share resources with the community but also for my personal benefit of documenting all the awesome tools and techniques I discover, only to eventually lose track of them.

title: Introduction
text: This is the introduction of the book.

title: Chapter 1: Getting Started
text:
This chapter introduces the Python environment and packages for geospatial AI.

# Install or import packages
import geopandas as gpd
import rasterio
import numpy as np

print("Environment ready")

Environment ready

title: Chapter 2: GIS Basics
text:
I can write a few things here

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
